com.dmurph.mvc.model
Class AbstractRevertableModel

java.lang.Object
  com.dmurph.mvc.model.AbstractModel
      com.dmurph.mvc.model.AbstractRevertableModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICloneable, IDirtyable, IRevertable
public abstract class AbstractRevertableModel
extends AbstractModel
implements IDirtyable, ICloneable, IRevertable

This model keeps track of original and changed property values through the firePropertyChange(String, Object, Object) method. Assuming an extending class correctly implements firePropertyChange(String, Object, Object) and setProperty(String, Object) correctly, this class will keep track of any changes to the model so the model can save or revert changes. This also makes the isDirty() method more accurate, as it can check all the properties to see if they have changed.

Author:
Daniel Murphy

Method Detail

isDirty

public boolean isDirty()
If the model is "dirty", or changed since last save. This method can be expensive, as it checks all changed properties to see if they are dirty. Will also return true if setDirty(boolean) was recently called with true.

Specified by:
isDirty in interface IDirtyable
Returns:
if the object is dirty, if it was changed since the last time IDirtyable.setDirty(boolean) was called with false.
See Also:
IDirtyable.isDirty()

setDirty

public boolean setDirty(boolean argDirty)
If called with false, this is the equivalent of saveChanges(). If called with true, the model is dirty until saveChanges(), revertChanges(), or this method is called with false.

Specified by:
setDirty in interface IDirtyable
Returns:
the previous dirty value
See Also:
IDirtyable.setDirty(boolean)

firePropertyChange

protected void firePropertyChange(String argPropertyName,
                                  Object argOldValue,
                                  Object argNewValue)
Description copied from class: AbstractModel
Fires a property change event. If the argOldValue == argNewValue or argOldValue.equals( argNewValue) then no event is thrown.

Overrides:
firePropertyChange in class AbstractModel
Parameters:
argPropertyName - property name, should match the get and set methods for property name
See Also:
AbstractModel.firePropertyChange(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)

setProperty

protected abstract void setProperty(String argPropertyName,
                                    Object argValue)
Used to reset variables when revertChanges() is called.

Parameters:
argPropertyName - the property name corresponding to the name given to the firePropertyChange(String, Object, Object) method
argValue - the value to set the property

saveChanges

public boolean saveChanges()
Description copied from interface: IRevertable
Saves the current changes to the model so further calls to IRevertable.revertChanges() will revert changes to the model's current state.

Specified by:
saveChanges in interface IRevertable
Returns:
if there were changes to save
See Also:
IRevertable.saveChanges()

revertChanges

public boolean revertChanges()
Description copied from interface: IRevertable
Reverts the model to the last time IRevertable.saveChanges() was called, or to it's original state if IRevertable.saveChanges() was never called.

Specified by:

if changed were reverted
